intro: Haplopappus linearifolius, commonly known as the linearleaf pappus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive bract structures. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought and high sunlight exposure. Its linear, grass-like leaves are arranged in a basal rosette, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Haplopappus linearifolius is often found in rocky soils and is considered a rare and endemic species in its native range.
